  "title": "Research Writer",
  "description": "HR-on-Wheels is a Human Resource consulting firm with focus to add value to the businesses of SMEs by emphazing the need to have a people strategy in place.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Research Writer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ibadan, Oyo or Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	Our client is looking for a skilled and curious Research Writer to help turn research ideas into compelling academic papers, white papers, and thought leadership content.
	We welcome candidates with strong evidence of research writing and publications, including those currently completing advanced degrees or building their academic careers.


Key Responsibilities


	Research, write, and contribute to white papers on governance, development, and indigenous knowledge systems
	Draft and co-author academic and policy-focused publications, including peer-reviewed articles
	Write opinion pieces, briefs, and thought leadership articles for international and mainstream media
	Conduct desk research and contribute to the organization&rsquo;s Insights newsletter
	Support the presentation of research at conferences, policy forums, and stakeholder events
	Collaborate with internal teams, external researchers, and support junior researchers or interns
	Provide research support for fundraising proposals and donor materials


What We&rsquo;re Looking For


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in African Studies, Political Science, Development Studies, Economics, or a related field
	Master&rsquo;s degree or PhD (completed or in progress) is an advantage, but not required
	Demonstrated research and writing experience, with evidence of publications (academic, policy, or media)
	Strong writing skills for both academic and non-academic audiences
	Interest or working knowledge in African governance, development, or indigenous knowledge systems
	Ability to work independently while collaborating closely with senior leadership


Salary

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Research Writer

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo or Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

            
    




	Our client is looking for a skilled and curious Research Writer to help turn research ideas into compelling academic papers, white papers, and thought leadership content.
	We welcome candidates with strong evidence of research writing and publications, including those currently completing advanced degrees or building their academic careers.


Key Responsibilities


	Research, write, and contribute to white papers on governance, development, and indigenous knowledge systems
	Draft and co-author academic and policy-focused publications, including peer-reviewed articles
	Write opinion pieces, briefs, and thought leadership articles for international and mainstream media
	Conduct desk research and contribute to the organization’s Insights newsletter
	Support the presentation of research at conferences, policy forums, and stakeholder events
	Collaborate with internal teams, external researchers, and support junior researchers or interns
	Provide research support for fundraising proposals and donor materials


What We’re Looking For


	Bachelor’s degree in African Studies, Political Science, Development Studies, Economics, or a related field
	Master’s degree or PhD (completed or in progress) is an advantage, but not required
	Demonstrated research and writing experience, with evidence of publications (academic, policy, or media)
	Strong writing skills for both academic and non-academic audiences
	Interest or working knowledge in African governance, development, or indigenous knowledge systems
	Ability to work independently while collaborating closely with senior leadership


Salary
N200,000 – N250,000 / month.

Graphic Designer (Consultant) Job at Palladium




        
    

        
        Palladium is a global leader in the design, development and delivery of Positive Impact - the intentional creation of enduring social and economic value. We work with foundations, investors, governments, corporations, communities and civil society to formulate strategies and implement solutions that generate lasting social, environmental and financial benefits.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphic Designer (Consultant)

Job Ref.: req24849
Job Location: Abuja, Nigeria

Project Overview and Role
     

            
    




	Data for Implementation (Data.FI) is a multi-year global project funded by the United States government (USG) and implemented by Palladium.
	Data.FI is designed to strengthen health information systems, enhance data use, and support evidence-based decision-making to improve health outcomes, particularly in the areas of HIV, tuberculosis (TB), COVID-19, and other priority health conditions.
	In Nigeria, Data.FI serves as USG’s flagship data and digital health project, working in close collaboration with government stakeholders at both federal and state levels. 


Purpose of Position 


	Palladium is seeking to employ the services of a Graphic Designer with adequate experience in illustrations, layouts, and other visual assets.
	The Graphic Designer will work closely with the Communications team to design and develop content ensuring they are visually appealing and user-friendly for the Data.FI Project.
	This role will involve creating high-quality content that effectively communicates the Data.FI project initiative, and activities in line with brand guidelines and message.
	The Graphic Designer will report to the Senior Communications Officer. 


Primary Duties and Responsibilities


	Design and produce visually appealing graphics, including banners, posters, flyers, and other visibility materials, that support project objectives.
	Ensure all design outputs are user-friendly and optimized for various formats (web, mobile, reports, newsletters, and event materials).
	Develop high-quality visual content for the Data.FI website, social media platforms, reports, and newsletters.
	Stay updated on modern design trends, tools, and technologies to enhance content quality.
	Support the development and implementation of a content calendar in collaboration with the Communications team.
	Edit and proofread design work to ensure clarity, accuracy, and consistency.
	Create design concepts and drafts for review, adjusting based on team feedback.


Collaboration and Communication:


	Work closely with cross-functional teams the business analyst, development, and communications to ensure cohesive brand messaging.
	Clearly communicate design and content concepts clearly to team members.
	Provide creative input on communication products and initiatives to ensure alignment with design and content strategies.


Required Qualifications


	A minimum of 3 years of proven experience in Graphic Design, Communications, or a related field.
	Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign), and other relevant design software.
	Strong portfolio demonstrating previous design work (digital, print, infographics, layouts).
	A certification in graphic design will be an added advantage.


Application Requirement


	Applicants must include links to previous graphic design work or an online portfolio. Applications without work samples will not be considered.
